summary: A sweeping new ICE operation shows how Donald Trump’s focus on immigration is reshaping federal law enforcement.
story: A sweeping new ICE operation shows how Donald Trump’s focus on immigration is reshaping federal law enforcement. Higher steel tariffs kick in. A potential new dwarf planet is identified. And food maker Campbell’s says more people are reaching for pantry staples over snacks.
Here’s what to know today.

The Trump administration’s largest immigration crackdown yet is underway, but the reallocation of personnel from other federal law enforcement agencies in order to carry out “Operation At Large” is causing tension among some officials who feel they’ve been taken off core national security missions.

The new ICE-led initiative is a response to frustration from White House chief of staff Stephen Miller over what he saw as numbers of arrests and deportations of unauthorized immigrants that were too low. Miller is so frustrated, two sources said, that he has berated and threatened to fire senior ICE officials if they did not begin detaining 3,000 migrants a day. He also threatened to fire leaders of field offices posting the bottom 10% of arrest numbers monthly.
This is Morning Rundown, a weekday newsletter to start your day. Sign up here to get it in your inbox.
According to the operation plan, the initiative calls on help from thousands of personnel, including:
→ 3,000 ICE agents, including 1,800 from Homeland Security Investigations, which generally investigates transnational crimes;
→ 2,000 Justice Department employees from the FBI, U.S. Marshals Service and the DEA;
→ 500 employees from Customs and Border Protection; and
→ 250 IRS agents, some of whom may be used to provide tax information on the whereabouts of immigrants using tax information, and others who would have the authority to make arrests.

The operation is the latest example of how President Donald Trump’s push for mass deportations is reshaping federal law enforcement, leaving less time and attention for other types of criminal investigations.

Now, FBI agents are joining in on immigration-related law enforcement operations, which at one time would have been unusual. DOJ teams focused on other issues are being disbanded so members can dedicate their time to immigration and other administration priorities. Federal courts are regularly seeing misdemeanor cases for border crossings, a rarity in recent years. And federal cases without immigration components have stalled or are moving more slowly.

“There is such a priority on making immigration arrests that it takes longer to get answers on anything else,” a law enforcement official said. “Something that used to be resolved in a matter of days now takes weeks.”
Read the full story here.

Trump’s executive order raising steel tariffs from 25% to 50% is now in effect, giving one of the country’s most storied industries a massive boost at the potential cost of a broader economic slowdown.

Trump’s executive order raising steel tariffs from 25% to 50% is now in effect, giving one of the country’s most storied industries a massive boost at the potential cost of a broader economic slowdown.
Elon Musk called the GOP bill for Trump’s agenda a “disgusting abomination” for the legislation’s proposal to add more than $2 trillion to the budget deficit.
Elon Musk called the GOP bill for Trump’s agenda a “disgusting abomination” for the legislation’s proposal to add more than $2 trillion to the budget deficit.
The White House wants congressional leaders to codify $9.4 billion budget cuts, mostly to foreign aid but also to cuts proposed by DOGE and to NPR and PBS.
The White House wants congressional leaders to codify $9.4 billion budget cuts, mostly to foreign aid but also to cuts proposed by DOGE and to NPR and PBS.
The Navy said it will rename the USNS Harvey Milk, the vessel named for the LGBTQ rights pioneer.
The Navy said it will rename the USNS Harvey Milk, the vessel named for the LGBTQ rights pioneer.
House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries is pushing a “more is more” approach when it comes to Democrats’ response to the Trump administration, but some argue it’s not a winning strategy.
House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries is pushing a “more is more” approach when it comes to Democrats’ response to the Trump administration, but some argue it’s not a winning strategy.
How measles tore through a remote West Texas city

On a Saturday in mid-March in the tiny West Texas city of Seminole, Dr. Ben Edwards put on his scrubs and drove to a sheet metal building to treat children with measles. Red spots mottled his face; Edwards was sick with measles, too.

An outbreak of the disease was swelling in Gaines County, a rural community with one of the lowest childhood vaccination rates in the country. For two weeks, lines of families had snaked around the building’s parking lot, almost all belonging to the area’s Mennonite community. Edwards handed out cod liver oil and prescribed steroid inhalers. And down the road at Seminole’s only hospital, a waiting room made for measles patients often sat empty, and there was little demand for vaccines — the only proven way of preventing the disease.

So two responses were in motion to deal with an extremely contagious disease — one grounded in science and evidence, and the other driven by distrust and propaganda and, for the first time in memory, backed by the federal government under Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.

The story of Seminole in those critical months offers a look behind the battle lines, as well as a warning for a country increasingly fractured not just by politics but by competing realities. Read senior reporter Brandy Zadrozny’s full story here.
Possible new dwarf planet spotted in our solar system

They set out to find “Planet Nine” — and instead turned up a different resident in our cosmic backyard. Researchers at Institute for Advanced Study and Princeton University said they have discovered a possible dwarf planet at the edge of the solar system. Measuring at an estimated 435 miles across, it’s significantly smaller than Pluto, which measures nearly 1,500 miles across. And it’s so far-flung that it takes around 25,000 years to complete one orbit around the sun.

Researchers said they found the dwarf planet candidate by sifting through a huge data set from a telescope in Chile that was scanning the universe for evidence of dark energy. If confirmed, the object known as 2017 OF201 could be what research group leader Sihao Cheng called an “extreme cousin” of Pluto.
In the meantime, the search for “Planet Nine,” a hypothetical planet larger than Earth that is thought to orbit beyond Neptune, is still on. Read the full story here.
Read All About It

The wife and five children of the suspect accused of launching an antisemitic attack that injured 12 people in Boulder, Colorado, were taken into ICE custody, the White House said. Meanwhile, an 88-year-old Holocaust survivor who was burned during the attack spoke publicly for the first time since the incident.

The wife and five children of the suspect accused of launching an antisemitic attack that injured 12 people in Boulder, Colorado, were taken into ICE custody, the White House said. Meanwhile, an 88-year-old Holocaust survivor who was burned during the attack spoke publicly for the first time since the incident.

Ukraine’s audacious “Spiderweb” drone attack on Russian air bases highlights how both sides are increasingly turning to cheap, commercially available devices that can be converted into deadly weapons and have huge impacts on the war.

Ukraine’s audacious “Spiderweb” drone attack on Russian air bases highlights how both sides are increasingly turning to cheap, commercially available devices that can be converted into deadly weapons and have huge impacts on the war.
A Washington state man is wanted on first-degree murder charges in the killings of his three daughters, who were found dead after they did not return from a planned visitation.
A Washington state man is wanted on first-degree murder charges in the killings of his three daughters, who were found dead after they did not return from a planned visitation.
The New York Knicks fired head coach Tom Thibodeau a day after the team finished its deepest run in the NBA playoffs in decades.
The New York Knicks fired head coach Tom Thibodeau a day after the team finished its deepest run in the NBA playoffs in decades.
Staff Pick: Canned soup summer?

Campbell’s expects one, NBC News producer Steve Kopack reports. The food maker says customers are shying away from snacks and prioritizing pantry basics, like condensed soup and mac-and-cheese, to save money. Consumers’ economic outlooks have improved in recent weeks, but pessimism runs deep amid ongoing trade war uncertainty. And while inflation has cooled sharply, many shoppers are still adjusting to much higher costs. With restaurant menu prices still rising nearly twice as fast as those on grocery shelves, Campbell’s is seeing people cook meals at home at the highest levels since the depths of the pandemic. — Rich Bellis, senior business editor
NBC Select: Online Shopping, Simplified

It can be hard to find a foundation for rosacea-prone skin, so one NBC Select editor tried over 20 foundations from brands like Lancôme and Haus Labs to find the best options available. Plus, the Select team also found the best washable rugs for living rooms, bedrooms and even outdoor areas.
Sign up to The Selection newsletter for hands-on product reviews, expert shopping tips and a look at the best deals and sales each week.
Thanks for reading today’s Morning Rundown. Today’s newsletter was curated for you by Elizabeth Robinson. If you’re a fan, please send a link to your family and friends. They can sign up here.

title: ‘Wheel of Fortune,’ ‘Jeopardy!’ Will Soon Be Available to Stream for the 1st Time: How to Watch
summary: “Jeopardy!” and “Wheel of Fortune” will stream the next day on Peacock, Hulu and Hulu on Disney+ beginning in September.
story: If you’ve ever been bummed out that you missed an episode of “Jeopardy!” or “Wheel of Fortune,” have we got some good news for you.

Sony Pictures Television announced June 3 it has reached next-day streaming deals for episodes of the iconic game shows with Peacock, Hulu and Hulu on Disney+. (Peacock is owned by TODAY.com's parent company, NBCUniversal.)
It marks the first time in-season syndicated episodes will be accessible on streaming services, while a library of other episodes will also be available.

“We are thrilled to bring America’s favorite game shows to an even wider audience on Hulu, Hulu on Disney+, and Peacock,” Sony Pictures Television Chairman Keith Le Goy said in a statement announcing the news.
“‘Jeopardy!’ and ‘Wheel of Fortune’ are two of the most successful game shows in television history and we look forward to giving fans the best possible streaming access to our shows this fall.”
Episodes will be available beginning in September, when both shows begin new seasons.
Sony hopes placing both long-running shows on these streaming services will solidify their standing on the small screen, while also appealing to the next wave of fans.

“These deals will expand ‘Jeopardy!’ and ‘Wheel of Fortune’s’ reach to a new generation of viewers while ensuring that existing fans can enjoy their favorite shows with greater accessibility, deepening the fandom overall for these formidable franchises,” the company said.
“Wheel of Fortune” is in its 42nd season, with Ryan Seacrest in his first season as co-host after he replaced Pat Sajak last September.
“Jeopardy!” is in its 41st season. Ken Jennings has been the solo host since the 40th season in 2023 after Mayim Bialik announced she would no longer split hosting duties with him.
Jennings and Bialik officially took over as co-hosts after the program had several guest hosts filling in after Alex Trebek died in 2020.

title: Tim McGraw and Faith Hill's Daughter Gracie Sends ‘Very Clear’ Message About Her Sexuality
summary: Gracie McGraw, the daughter of country singers Tim McGraw and Faith Hill, said she has been an "out and proud queer, bisexual woman" after tabloid media said she has recently come out.
story: Gracie McGraw, the daughter of country music stars Tim McGraw and Faith Hill, said she has been an "out and proud queer, bisexual woman" after tabloid media said she had come out in an Instagram post.
The 28-year-old posted a message to her Instagram followers on June 3.
"It has come to my attention that some tabloids have taken an Instagram story I posted yesterday and have used it as click bait saying I've 'come out,'" she wrote.
"Let me be VERY clear here," she continued. "I've been an out and proud, queer bisexual woman and I wouldn't have it any other way."
Gracie McGraw added that she has been "very vocal" about her support of LGBTQ+ rights and the community, and cheekily thanked the media outlets for "shedding light that it's pride month!!!"

"So many people out there don't have the support, love or understanding from their families when it comes to sexuality or gender identity, but just know that there is a beautiful community out there that loves you and cares about and for you," she said.
Gracie McGraw finished her Instagram story with a call to her followers to check on the people in their lives and "keep safe out there."
The post comes after she reposted a message on June 2 that read "Everyone get more gay now" on her Instagram story.
"HAPPY FREAKING PRIDE," she captioned the post, adding, "I love being queer."
The reshared post led to several media outlets writing headlines about her message, with many saying she had come out or identified as queer.
Gracie McGraw's parents haven't publicly commented on their daughter's sexuality, but her father posted a throwback photo in honor of her 28th birthday last month.

"Can’t believe this little bit turns 28 today! Happy birthday to our Gracie! You are a light in this world my sweet girl. So much heart, soul, respect and yes LOADS of talent!!! We hope you have the best day ever and know that you are loved beyond measure! I love you my little girl," Tim McGraw wrote in the caption of an Instagram post, signing the message with "- Dad."

Gracie McGraw is the oldest child of Tim McGraw and Faith Hill, who also share two younger daughters, Maggie and Audrey. The trio joined their father on stage in Nashville last month while he was performing at the Music City Rodeo on May 31.
They performed his 2007 hit “Last Dollar (Fly Away),” and the country star said his daughters used to belt the song “when they were little kids.”
“They’re all grown up now!” Tim McGraw said at the end of the track before he gave them a hug. “My girls!”

title: Meghan Markle Celebrates Daughter Lilibet’s 4th Birthday With Never-Before-Seen Pics
summary: Meghan Markle marked her and Prince Harry's daughter's 4th birthday with a pair of photos of her with Lilibet that she posted on Instagram.
story: Meghan Markle is celebrating daughter Lilibet’s birthday.
On June 4, the Duchess of Sussex posted a pair of photos of her little girl in honor of Lilibet turning 4.

“Happy birthday to our beautiful girl! Four years ago today she came into our lives — and each day is brighter and better because of it. Thanks to all of those sending love and celebrating her special day!” Markle wrote.
One photo captures Markle holding on to Lilibet, whose face is obscured, while they appear to be out on the water. The second picture shows Markle looking down while holding Lilibet as a newborn.
Meghan and her husband, Prince Harry, are also parents to son Archie, who turned 6 in May.

“Our son. Our sun. Happy 6th birthday to Archie!” Meghan captioned an Instagram post featuring a picture of him in pajamas on a deck with his back to the camera overlooking a body of water. “Thank you for all of the love, prayers, and warm wishes for our sweet boy. He’s six! Where did the time go?”

Archie and Lilibet didn’t appear in their mother’s Netflix series, “With Love, Meghan.” While Meghan and Harry don’t offer many looks at their kids, Meghan did give fans a peek at them with a collage of her life with Harry that included some shots of their children in honor of their seventh anniversary. One image   showed Archie kissing Lilibet on the forehead.
In April, Meghan shared a video of her making strawberry jam on her Instagram story that got the seal of approval from her daughter.
“What do we think, Lili?” Meghan asked Lilibet, who was off-camera.
“I think it’s beautiful,” Lilibet responded.
In March, Meghan also posted a picture of her daughter sitting in Harry’s lap while they were in a boat.

“Happy International Women’s Day!” she captioned the post, which featured a series of photos. “Celebrating the strong women around us & the girls with dreams who will become women with vision. Also thanking those who uplift us every day.”
Meghan also posted a video on her Instagram story that same month featuring Lilibet playing the classic board game Candy Land with tennis legend Serena Williams.
“When the aunties come to celebrate…and to play!” Markle captioned the clip. “Love you @serenawilliams.”

In addition, Lilibet was seen in a picture for her mother’s lifestyle brand, As Ever. The image featured the pair in matching white outfits, with Lilibet holding her mother’s hand as they walked through a field.

title: Who Is Halle Berry's Boyfriend? All About Van Hunt
summary: Halle Berry and her boyfriend, Van Hunt, met in 2020 and have been together since the COVID pandemic. Here's what to know about him.
story: After years together, Halle Berry and Van Hunt are still lucky in love.
Ever since they went public with their relationship in 2020, the actor and her musician beau haven't been shy about public displays of affection and adorable declarations of love.
In May, the couple appeared in bed together in a cheeky video underneath the sheets. When Hunt celebrated a birthday earlier this year, Berry called him her “best friend.”
Meanwhile, Hunt has said he feels “warm and fuzzy” seeing his longtime girlfriend so happy in their relationship.
What has Berry gushing so much about her relationship? Read on to learn more about Hunt.
Van Hunt Is a Grammy-Winning Musician
Much like Berry, Hunt is also in the entertainment industry and is an accomplished musician with several albums under his belt.
Record executive and “American Idol” alum Randy Jackson began managing Hunt in 2002, per Essence.
Hunt has been nominated for two Grammy awards and has won one for R&B Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals in 2007 for “Family Affair.”
In 2021, Berry told People her beau made music for her film “Bruised” and wrote the title song.
While appearing on an episode of the “Armchair Expert with Dax Shepard” podcast in 2024, Berry called her beau a “wonderful lyricist,” adding, “his songs have meaning.”
Van Hunt Is a Proud Dad
Hunt described parenting his son as “a lot of fun” in a 2011 interview.
“I can’t imagine anybody not wanting to explore the opportunity to be a father, if you should decide to have a child,” he said at the time.
While chatting with Entertainment Tonight in 2021, Hunt said Berry had influenced more than just his music and had helped shaped the way he parents his son.

“The inspiration for our relationship goes across everything, even in my parenting. I’m a completely different person, I can say it like that, and I think that it’s improved every aspect of my life,” he said.
Van Hunt and Halle Berry met through a friend
On the “Armchair Expert with Dax Shepard” in 2024, Berry explained how she met Hunt through a friend.

As it turns out, Hunt’s brother worked with someone who was working with Berry on her Respin brand. A year before the pandemic hit, he suggested that they would be a great fit and she said she didn’t do relationship setups. Later on, another colleague suggested the same thing.
Meanwhile, Hunt’s brother was hounding the musician, telling him he should call Berry. At the onset of the pandemic, he made a move and texted her.
Van Hunt and Halle Berry Grew Close During the Pandemic
During the early days of their courtship, Hunt and Berry took things slow.

“Because of COVID, we spent four months talking on the phone. We were forced to only let our brains connect and discover if we had a connection before our bodies decided to get involved. I’d never done it this way. We talked for hours and hours and hours and hours and never got tired,” Berry told AARP in 2022.
Slowly but surely, Berry “fell in love with his mind.”
“I really liked who he was, and I can’t say I felt that way before. I really believe I’ve found my person. I fell in love with him before I even met him,” she added.
While chatting with Marie Claire about her relationship in September 2024, Berry said she and Hunt waited to become intimate with each other until they were in love.

“It was the first time I was madly in love before I had sex. That has never happened to me, ever,” she said. “Talk about one of those life-changing, beautiful experiences. It was magical, just magical.”
The couple went public with their relationship in 2020 and have been going strong ever since.
Van Hunt Studied English at Morehouse College
Before leaving Morehouse College to embark on a career in music, Hunt was an English major.
In a 2020 interview with Essence, he said he was a “terrible student” but admitted he’d likely be working in “applied mathematics or astrophysics” if he weren’t a musician.
Van Hunt's Grandfather Came Up With His Name

During an interview with Essence, Hunt shared the story behind his name, saying, “My grandfather found the name, but he wasn’t much of a talker. So no one knows really where the name came from. My father is older than the invention of the van (laughs), so I know it didn’t come from there.”
Van Hunt Loves Boxing
Boxing is one of several ways Hunt likes to stay active. While speaking with Essence in 2020, he revealed that he started the workout while working on his last album.
“Someone had bought the training for me as a gift just to distract me from the process,” he said.
Halle Berry Says She ‘Manifested’ Van Hunt
While appearing on TODAY with Jenna & Friends in February 2025, Berry said she “manifested” her boyfriend.

“Having gone through three divorces, I finally knew what wasn’t working, and I realized I was always saying to the universe what I didn’t want — what I didn’t want,” she said. “So guess what I did? I manifested what I didn’t want. So, I really had to change my thinking, and instead of thinking of what I didn’t want, I had to get intentional with what I did want.”
During a 2021 interview with Women's Health, Berry also gushed about the divine timing of her relationship with Hunt.

“I wish I had met him sooner so I could have loved him longer. I just feel fulfilled. I feel happy in my life romantically, as a mother, as an artist. I’m a much better mother in this circumstance than I would have been had I stayed in a romantic relationship that didn’t serve me and didn’t make me feel the way I need to feel as a woman,” she said.

title: 'Sister Wives' Star Robyn Brown Has a Message for Kody Brown's Ex-Wives
summary: When it comes to her role in her family's failed plural marriage, Robyn Brown is staying in her own lane, and she'd like her former sister wives to do the same.
story: When it comes to her role in her family's failed plural marriage, Robyn Brown is staying in her own lane, and she'd like her former sister wives to do the same.
During a new "Sister Wives: One on One" special, the reality star opened up about the tense dynamic she has with Meri and Janelle Brown and Christine Brown Woolley.
The four women were previously part of a plural marriage with Kody Brown. He is now only married to Robyn Brown, who the other women have often referred to as the "favorite wife."

Throughout Season 19 of the TLC series, Kody Brown's former wives have commented at length about the role Robyn Brown's relationship with Kody Brown played in driving a wedge between him and his other wives. It's a topic Robyn Brown addressed during the new TV special.
“I think there’s a lot of focus on me. I actually get really tired of it,” she told host Sukanya Krishnan.
Robyn Brown went on to share her hopes for a more cordial dynamic moving forward.
"I wish really badly that they would all focus on their own relationships and work those relationships out without my name coming up," she said.
Elsewhere during the special, Janelle Brown acknowledged that "a lot of people want to pin the blame on Robyn."
“I don’t think that she is necessarily innocent in this,” she said. “I mean, it takes two.”
The mother of six went on to suggest that Kody Brown has made himself "even more villainous" in an attempt to "take away some of the blame from her."
When Krishnan asked Robyn Brown if she thinks her husband "has a bias" when it comes to her, she offered a succinct response: "I don't think so."
During another part of her interview with Robyn Brown, Krishnan asked if she enjoyed being called Kody Brown's "sacred cow," a nickname Janelle Brown used for her during a confessional interview.
"Moo. I don't know. Whatever. I don't care," she said.
"Is that like, a term?" Krishnan asked.
"I don’t know what that is. I’m not sure where that came from," she replied.
During Part One of the "Sister Wives: One on One" special, Kody Brown addressed his marriage with Robyn Brown and the criticism they've received over the years.

“There’s a divine aspect about my relationship with Robyn,” he said. “And we have been b----slapped for it and I’m sick of it. I'm like walking around like, 'I love this woman and I want peace in this relationship.' But I’m to the point where I’m walking around flipping two birds cause I am so sick and tired of being guilted for loving Robyn."

title: Lea Thompson Celebrates Birthday With a ‘Back to the Future’ Reunion ... Calvin Klein Undies and All
summary: Actress Lea Thompson celebrated her birthday in a very “Back to the Future” way: with former castmates, including Michael J. Fox, and her new granddaughter.
story: Actress Lea Thompson celebrated her recent birthday in the most “Back to the Future” way possible. In a carousel of images posted to Instagram, she included a little bit of her past — her movie co-stars, including Michael J. Fox — and a little nod to the future — her granddaughter.
Thompson, who turned 64 on May 31, took on a new role this year: grandmother.

Four-month-old granddaughter Robbie June Carlisle is prominently featured in the photos of Thompson's "beautiful birthday days." In a nod to the pivotal "Back to the Future" bedroom scene, baby Robbie looks adorable in her Calvin Klein underwear.

In addition to photos of her coworkers from "The Chicken Sisters," Thompson included images of two of her "Back to the Future" castmates: Michael J. Fox, who played Marty McFly in the iconic movie, and Thomas F. Wilson, who played Marty's nemesis, Biff Tannen. Thompson played love interest (and Marty's mom) Lorraine Baines.
The three actors had just reunited to celebrate the 40th anniversary of the movie's release with a Dallas, Texas fan experience.

Thompson met her husband, director Howard Deutch, on the set of "Some Kind of Wonderful," and they wed in 1989. They have two daughters who are both involved in show business: Madelyn, 34, is an actor, writer and photographer while Zoey, 31, starred in "The Politician," among other projects.

“I’m a grandmother, friends!” Thompson posted on Feb. 9, alongside a carousel of baby images. Granddaughter Robbie had been born to Madelyn and her literary agent husband Zach Carlisle just days before.
"Such joy and happiness is singing in my heart. I am so grateful and proud of Maddie and Zach for having the faith and grace to take a chance on love," Thompson wrote.
"Howie, Zoey and I are are over the moon in love. Congratulations, Maddie! My baby is a mama …"

title: How to Watch 'Sinners' at Home
summary: Ryan Coogler’s film “Sinners,” one of the biggest blockbuster movies of the year, is finally available to stream at home. Here's how you can watch it.
story: Ryan Coogler’s film “Sinners,” one of the biggest blockbuster movies of the year, is finally available to stream at home.

The vampire epic, in which Michael B. Jordan plays twins Smoke and Stack, has captured fans’ attention all over the world since it arrived in theaters in April. So far, it has grossed over $350 million worldwide and over $260 million in the United States, according to Box Office Mojo.

“Sinners” begins with Smoke and Stack, who are both feared and beloved in their community, returning to their home in the Mississippi Delta to open a juke joint. They gather everyone and everything they need for the grand opening, but when the sun goes down, supernatural forces disrupt the night. The ending involves an intense showdown and also includes two post-credits scenes, with a twist.

The highly-praised movie, also starring Delroy Lindo, Hailee Steinfeld, Wunmi Mosaku, Jack O’Connell, Jayme Lawson, Omar Benson Miller and Li Jun Li, has been a hot topic of conversation on social media for months, as fans dissect the plot, share theories and applaud Coogler’s filmmaking.
Now, fans will be able to experience the thriller again from the comfort of their couch or catch it for the first time and see what all the buzz is about.
With Fandango recently announcing that the horror flick is available to rent or own, the conversation surrounding “Sinners” will surely continue.
Find out how you can stream “Sinners,” below.
When will ‘Sinners’ be available to stream?
Fandango announced Tuesday, June 3, that “Sinners” is now available to watch from home. The movie company celebrated the arrival of “Sinners” on streaming by sharing a deleted scene from the film.
The clip shows nearly all the main characters making their way to Smoke and Stack’s juke joint, a repurposed sawmill, for the party.
Where to stream ‘Sinners’
“Sinners” is streaming on Fandango at Home, the video-on-demand streaming service previously known as Vudu.
Fans can purchase the flick for $24.99 or rent it for $19.99.

title: Ilona Maher Was Asked If It's 'Tough Being in a Swimsuit' — Here's Her Response
summary: Ilona Maher is opening up about body positivity after walking the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Runway Show on May 31.
story: Ilona Maher is opening up about her most recent gig with Sports Illustrated and being a role model for girls who love sports.

On June 3, the 28-year-old rugby player appeared on TODAY with Jenna & Friends to discuss her recent projects. These include her walking at the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Runway Show on May 31, less than a year after she appeared as the cover star for Sports Illustrated’s digital September issue in 2024.
"It was amazing," Maher said of her collaborations with the sports magazine before recalling some of the reactions she's received.
"Somebody asked me, like, 'Was it tough being a swimsuit?'" Maher recalled.

"I love it," she said of her response to the question. "I love showing my body. I love showing what this body has done for me. I mean, I’ve been to two Olympics now. It does amazing things on the field, and it’s just perfect for what it does. And so strong."
Beyond her appreciation for her body, Maher expressed how rewarding it is to know that she's inspiring young girls with body types that are similar to hers.

"I think other girls seeing that and feeling like, 'Oh my gosh, I look like her, I have the frame of her' — I think it not only has helped me, it made me feel more confident to help others, too," she commented.
"I've got so many like, messages like, 'That's my body.' I've seen it out there. And I'm like, You can be just as confident," she continued.

title: Salma Hayek Celebrates Stepson's Graduation With His Mom, Linda Evangelista
summary: Salma Hayek is stepmom to Linda Evangelista's son, Augustin, who just graduated high school.
story: One big, happy family!
Salma Hayek has shared photos of her 18-year-old stepson Augustin James Evangelista's high school graduation that included the teen's mom, modeling legend Linda Evangelista, 60.

Evangelista welcomed her only child, Augustin, or Augie, in 2006 after a brief romance with French billionaire Francois-Henri Pinault, 63, who began dating Hayek, 58, the same year and married her in 2009.

“Augie!!! We are so PROUD of you,” Hayek captioned a gallery of pics on on Instagram. “Congratulations for becoming the extraordinary young man that you are and managing to still be our lovely boy and congratulations to Linda, Francois and all the parents who got our babies up to this point. Easier said than done.”
The "Frida" star, who shares a daughter, Valentina, 17, with Pinault, added emoji of a graduation cap.

Hayek’s carousel included several shots of her embracing Augie, who posed cheekily with an unlit cigar. She also included a pic of her, Evangelista and Pinault all smiling alongside the new grad, who wore a royal blue graduation gown.
Hayek included two more shots of Augie beaming alongside his dad and a short video of Evangelista giving her son an emotional hug and kiss.
“Love you and all your support,” Evangelista told Hayek in the comments of her post. She added emoji of a heart and folded hands of gratitude.
Evangelista shared her own gallery of pics from Augie’s big day that included a photo of him holding his diploma and several pics of him posing with friends from school.
"Then this happened. I’m one proud momma. Blessed blessed blessed…" Evangelista wrote, adding emoji that included a heart, graduation cap and folded hands.

Evangelista honored Augie’s 18th birthday on Instagram in October 2024 by sharing photos of him over the years, including a few that showed him posing with Pinault and Hayek and his half-sister, Valentina.
In her caption, she tagged her son. “My man @a__pinault bringing the joy and light. #18.”
In an August 2023 interview with Vogue, Evangelista praised Hayek for going out of her way to make the previous holiday season special for their blended family.
"I was sick at Thanksgiving,” Evangelista revealed. “And Salma got on the plane with her daughter, came here and made Thanksgiving dinner.
"She asked what I wanted — it was a very eclectic wish list. I wanted her Mexican chicken with truffled potatoes. And she spent the day in the kitchen and cooked it herself," she continued.
"She made a feast— a beautiful, beautiful meal. I had told her that I wasn’t going to have Thanksgiving; I wasn’t feeling well. And she said, ‘Oh yes you are: I am coming.’ And poof, she was here.”

title: 'Love Island USA' Season 7 Premieres Tonight. Here's How to Watch
summary: Season 7 of "Love Island USA" airs tonight! Find out how you can watch the hit reality TV show, which is hosted by Ariana Madix this time around.
story: "Love Island USA" is back for more romance under the Fiji sun. The show's seventh season is set to kick off June 3, with episodes unfolding in real time over the course of about two months.
Peacock has already unveiled the first 10 islanders to enter the villa, with the rest of the cast joining in the coming weeks.

Speaking to TODAY.com, host Ariana Madix shared her advice for the cast, especially in light of last season's success. "Love Island USA" Season 6 shattered streaming records and led to a forthcoming spinoff following past cast members.

“I think that last year had so many viral sayings, phrases, moments. But if they go into it trying to come up with viral phrases and sayings, it won’t work,” Madix said. “Audiences are very smart, and they can always sense and feel when things are genuine and people are being authentic. That is what’s always going to resonate with people. They can always suss out when people are being a little bit performative.”
Scroll below to see how you can watch Season 7 of "Love Island USA."
When does ‘Love Island USA’ start?
The new season begins streaming on Tuesday, June 3.
What time is ‘Love Island USA’ on?
Each episode of "Love Island USA" drops at 6 p.m. PT/9 p.m. ET.
Where can I watch 'Love Island USA'?
"Love Island USA" is streaming exclusively on Peacock. Peacock is owned by NBCUniversal, TODAY's parent company.
The premiere episode will also air on Bravo at 10:15 p.m. ET/PT on June 11.
What is the 'Love Island USA’ premiere week schedule?
New episodes premiere every day of the first week of "Love Island," including Wednesday, June 4.
What days are new episodes of 'Love Island USA' on?
New episodes of "Love Island USA" stream Thursdays through Tuesdays. The recap show, "Aftersun," airs on Saturdays. Essentially, the only day without a new episode of "Love Island USA" is Wednesday.
Sunday: New episodeMonday: New episodeTuesday: New episodeWednesday: No episodeThursday: New episodeFriday: New episodeSaturday: "Aftersun" episode
Sunday: New episode
Monday: New episode
Tuesday: New episode
Wednesday: No episode
Thursday: New episode
Friday: New episode
Saturday: "Aftersun" episode
When does 'Love Island USA' Season 7 end?
Peacock has not announced when the final episode of "Love Island USA" Season 7 is expected to air.
However, if it's anything like Season 6, then you can expect the show to end sometime in late July.

title: Gia Giudice Says She’s Planning To Move at the End of the Summer
summary: Gia Giudice told TODAY.com that she is planning to move in September to either Manhattan or Jersey City.
story: Gia Giudice is looking to make moves.

Giudice, who’s the daughter of “Real Housewives of New Jersey” star Teresa Giudice and her ex-husband Joe Giudice, is one of the recognizable faces on the new Bravo reality series “Next Gen NYC,” debuting June 3.

The 24-year-old told TODAY.com at the show’s June 2 premiere party in New York City that she’s been commuting back and forth between her Jersey home and Manhattan to film the series, which follows a group of young adults navigating new lives in the city.

“It’s a lot,” Gia Giudice said of her busy schedule, adding, “My schedule has only picked up since ‘Next Gen NYC,’ which is funny, because it picked up the summer we were filming ‘Next Gen,’ and no one knew that we were filming it.
“It’s just my career kind of started picking up and my brand started growing, and I am in the city at least four times a week, so it’s a lot of back and forth from Jersey.”
Shuffling between the two locations, she said, has been “super exhausting.”
“I think in August, I’m really going to start looking at apartments and moving into something in September,” she said.
Does Giudice see herself relocating to Manhattan?
“I’m either going to do Manhattan or Jersey City,” she said. “I’m gonna figure it out.”
While a potential move to the Big Apple excites her, Giudice will still consider New Jersey home.
“I’ll still spend my weekend at home, maybe every other weekend at home. I have to see my Bella,” she said of her beloved pooch.
As for starring in her own Bravo series, Guidice, who began appearing on “The Real Housewives of New Jersey” as a child, said she wasn’t nervous at all.
“I wasn’t honestly scared. My life has been on the cameras for so long. I’m so open with my audience, and I just kept doing that on ‘Next Gen,’” she told TODAY.com.
The drama that unfolds on “Next Gen NYC,” said Guidice, is “more lightweight” than what viewers see on a “Real Housewives” show.
“It’s not as intense — as a friend group in their 20s, figuring it out, going through the motions, you know, figuring out what their next steps are, what our next steps are,” she explained.
“So the drama is like normal friendship drama,” she added.
Guidice isn’t the only familiar face on “Next Gen NYC.”

The show’s cast also includes other adult children of Bravo stars, including Riley Burruss, daughter of Kandi Burruss of “The Real Housewives of Atlanta”; Brooks Marks, son of “The Real Housewives of Salt Lake City” couple Meredith Marks and Seth Marks, and Ariana Biermann, daughter of “Don’t Be Tardy” star Kim Zolciak-Biermann.
Ava Dash, Emira D’Spain, Shai Fruchter, Georgia McCann, Hudson McLeroy, and Charlie Zakkour round out the show’s cast.
“Next Gen NYC” premieres June 3 at 9 p.m ET on Bravo and streams the next day on Peacock. (Bravo, Peacock and TODAY.com are owned by the same parent company, NBCUniversal.)

title: Prince Royce Was ‘Reluctant’ to Cover the Backstreet Boys. Why He’s Happy He Did
summary: Prince Royce brings classics to a new generation with bilingual bachata album "Eterno." He talks about the covers included on the album in a TODAY.com interview.
story: When Prince Royce released his first hit song, “Stand By Me,” in 2010, the singer wasn’t very excited about the moment.

“I was actually bummed out when I recorded 'Stand By Me' because originally I had released a song called ‘Corazón Sin Cara’ that was this song about inner beauty. It was this beautiful song that I had written and I thought was definitely a hit,” Royce, 36, tells TODAY.com. “And I put that song out, and it didn’t work.”
His record label suggested three songs to cover, including Ben E. King’s “Stand By Me.” He reluctantly recorded the song but with a Spanglish bachata twist and without any expectations.
The song became a hit, peaking at No. 8 on Billboard's Hot Latin Songs chart.
The success of “Stand By Me,” Royce says, really opened up a “lot of doors for me, and I realized what the power of a cover could do.”
Now, 15 years later, Royce is having a full-circle moment with his latest album, “Eterno,” which translates to "Eternal" and is a 13-track record of cover songs.

The singer brings his signature sultry bachata sound with the arrangements of classic hits from the Backstreet Boys, Bee Gees, the Beatles, Fleetwood Mac, Stevie Wonder and more — and yes, they include that Spanglish twist.

“Being able to bring certain people that remember the song back into their time, and reintroducing the song to a different generation,” he says, “I think that that’s what the concept of this album was, bringing that nostalgia back from the eras of the ‘70s, ‘80s, ‘90s, and reintroducing it to Latin America and to today.”

Earlier this year during Premio Lo Nuestro, Royce teased his album, out now, with a performance medley of the Temptations’ “My Girl,” “How Deep Is Your Love” by Bee Gees and King Harvest’s “Dancing in the Moonlight.”

Most recently, Royce and Richard Marx came together to sing the Spanglish version of “Right Here Waiting,” which is included in “Eterno.” The moment was captured on Instagram and shows the two artists switching in Spanish and English as they sing a verse and the chorus.
“I love that you’re going to turn a whole other generation on to this song,” Marx says in the video.
"I'm 100% Latino, Dominican, and also 100% American," Royce tells TODAY.com, adding, “This is so much more than just a covers album. It’s bringing all these cultures together.”
Below, Royce shares his insight into the creation of “Eterno,” touring and the growth of bachata in recent decades.
This interview has been condensed and edited for clarity.
What are some of the biggest challenges when selecting the covers for the album?
For me, it was getting educated on, getting very in depth with each song. Who wrote it, what genre was it, when did it come out? What did they do? I like respecting the record.

For the translations, I really wanted to be the closest to the original song, as far as the meaning of what they were trying to say — and then try to bring in my essence to it. You know, keep some things that I thought were key moments, but bring things that I felt could be different in my style or change it up. That's kind of how I went about each song.
You wrote all the new renditions. Talk to me about the process of putting your personal spin on the songs.

I think it was actually more difficult than doing my own albums because when I'm recording my own song, if I don't like something, I'll just change it. If I don't like a chord, if I don't like a melody, if I don't like a change that they presented to me, I would just change it and then that's it.

Here, I was more forced to stay in the box of what the original song was, because I didn't want to change it too much. I didn't want to be, like, crazy change and people be like, "Whoa, that wasn't what the song was." That'd be maybe an interpolation instead of a cover. That was really more the challenge, which, I like the challenge. I think the challenge was fun to do things with my voice that I normally wouldn't do.
The Backstreet Boys cover of "I Want It That Way" is a fun one and more modern. Tell me why you chose that song.

Everything was from back in the day and I said, "I don't know if this album is about just songs from the '70s or just the '80s. What about something from the '90s?" It was actually my producer who was like, "Yo, what about Backstreet?" And I thought, is that song old enough or is that too recent? But then I Googled it and it's 25 years old.

I think it’s safe to say that it’s (old) enough to say it’s a classic. And I think that’s been one of the favorites, for real. I feel like a lot of people genuinely have been drawn to that song, and I’m happy I included it because I was reluctant, thinking, “Man, is it too recent in comparison to the other songs?”
Were there any songs that you wanted to cover but weren't able to?

One of the songs was “Human Nature” by Michael Jackson. I had recorded it and I wasn’t sure if it perfectly fit in there. I decided to just leave it out because I was unsure if it flowed. I keep thinking, “Well, maybe I should have tried something else or tried harder.”
There’s so many artists that were left out. I mean, there’s just thousands of songs. There’s so many ways you can go.
You're planning on going on tour. What can fans expect and what will the songs from this album look like onstage?
There's no tour dates yet, but there should be a tour hopefully by the end of the year.

With every tour and every album, I always bring in hits from all the albums. I am going a little more theatrical with this album. I have 13 music videos and they all kind of connect. It goes a different way than the traditional music video, so I may go a little bit that route for the tour.
In your opinion, what is the state of bachata at the moment and how has it evolved since you released "Stand By Me"?

I think it’s always been good. In music and in fashion, anything, there’s always ups and downs. There’s always new trends, new sounds and new artists emerging in the art world, in acting and everything. As for me, as a bachata singer, and not just a singer of the genre but as a person who’s representing it as well, I feel like it’s almost my responsibility to still put that on people’s faces, help (the genre) grow and do collaborations.

In comparison to when I first started, a couple years ago now, I’ve seen it grow to a point where Colombian artists like Manuel Turizo are recording bachata. Shakira, she recorded her first bachata with me, she did another one with Ozuna. Rosalía sang bachata with The Weeknd. So many artists that aren’t just Dominican — because at first it was only maybe, like, Dominicans recording bachata. So I think it’s definitely grown into another space where people have been experimenting with it a little more in other countries.
Looking back on the last 15 years, what would you say is the biggest lesson you've learned, professionally or personally?

I’ve learned to have perseverance, to just keep going, to keep swimming. I’ve run two marathons, I’m running a third one, actually, this year. I’ve kind of applied that to life — like, you got to just keep going. You got to go through the rain, through the fire, through the wind and just keep going. I think that’s how music is. You got to just keep going and keep re-creating and believe in yourself and creating new ideas.

title: Dakota Johnson Roasts Herself for Wearing 'the Wrong Outfit' on Jimmy Fallon: 'My Eyes Are Up Here'
summary: Dakota Johnson Roasts Herself for Wearing 'the Wrong Outfit' on Jimmy Fallon: 'My Eyes Are Up Here'
story: Dakota Johnson called herself out on “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon” last night.
Sitting beside host Jimmy Fallon on June 2 to talk about her new film, “Materialists,” the actor, 35, looked down at her dress and gasped, blurting out, “Oh, God.”
After checking in to make sure she was all right, Fallon told Johnson she looked “fantastic,” to which she responded, “This was the wrong outfit.”
The camera then panned to show Johnson's short black dress with a plunging neckline, which she accompanied with black tights.
The two suddenly froze, laughing, looking at one another until Fallon told a joke: "Just don't move."
“My eyes are up here,” she quipped, causing an outburst of laugher from the live studio audience.
As The Roots, Fallon’s on-set band, played off Johnson’s joke with some percussion, Fallon looked up at the sky and said, “I can’t even look there. I don’t know what to do. Now, I’m confused.”

As Fallon attempted to start the interview, asking the actor about the last time they saw one another in 30 Rock for the "SNL" 50th anniversary special, Johnson sat motionless due to her outfit, attempting to hold back laughter.
Throughout the interview, Johnson continued fixing the neckline of her dress, at one point instructing Fallon, "Tell me if there's a problem."
“At this point, there’s not a problem,” he responded, then paused before adding, “There’s almost a problem. But not, not quite.”
“I’ll keep my posture real good,” she joked, sitting up straight and requesting a blanket to drape over herself.
Fallon then went behind his desk and pulled out a tissue to give to her. Johnson then situated the tissue inside the dress so her chest was completely covered.
After Fallon suggested she shouldn't "ruin" her outfit, Johnson removed the tissue and the interview continued — with casual dress adjustments and acknowledgements by the actor.
At the end of their conversation, Fallon told Johnson that her dad, Don Johnson, gifted him a cardigan sweater, which he subsequently pulled out from behind the desk.
When Fallon suggested Johnson “borrow” the sweater, she gave him a hard time, saying he probably just didn’t like the cardigan for himself.
Nevertheless, Johnson took the clothing and draped it over her chest, before sitting back into her chair and sighing, “Phew!”

title: Nelly and Ashanti: A timeline of their on-again, off-again relationship
summary: Read on for Nelly and Ashanti's relationship timeline. Here's when they got together, met on Verzuz, had a wedding, had a son and more.
story: Nelly and Ashanti have been through a lot together since they first met — except during the decade or so they went their separate ways.
In the early aughts, the couple were R&B royalty. They held court on the Billboard charts and shared a romance that had fans speculating about their happily ever after.
But in the 2010s, despite their bond, the relationship didn’t work out.
Until time healed the rift.

After a long break and a lot of personal growth, the entertainers found each other again, swapped vows in secret and even welcomed their first child together. Now they’re taking another big step, all the way to reality TV.

Mark the release of their new eight-episode Peacock docuseries, “Nelly & Ashanti: We Belong Together,” with a look back at the timeline of their love story. (Peacock is owned by NBCUniversal, TODAY's parent company).
2003: How Nelly met Ashanti

Ahead of the 45th Grammy Awards, where both Nelly and Ashanti were scheduled to perform, they attended the Recording Academy’s nominations announcement — separately. It was January of 2003, and moments before they learned they were both nominees that year, they met one another for the first time.
That’s when Nelly, at peak fame with his “Hot in Herre” single, made a memorable move.

“The first time I met Nelly, he asked me for my autograph,” Ashanti later recalled during a 2011 episode of VH1’s “Behind the Music.” “I think he was being sarcastic, and I remember writing it down on the program.”
Romance rumors started then and there, but Ashanti said fans jumped to conclusions too soon, adding, “For the record, it took him a long time to get my number.”
2005: Mixed messages

Nelly and Ashanti seemed tight throughout 2004 and 2005, having made public appearances side-by-side, and even cuddling up close at Ashanti’s 25th birthday bash on Oct. 13, 2005, at Glo Nightclub in New York City.
But even though their bond appeared undeniable by that point, that same year, Ashanti played coy, telling People magazine they just “went out,” and weren’t really “boyfriend and girlfriend.”
What was clear was that whatever they were to one another, it wasn’t something they were ready to define for the rest of the world.
2008: Good friends thinking about marriage
While these days, Nelly and Ashanti no longer deny those early years were, in fact, a real romantic relationship, back in 2008, they still weren’t ready to say it outright.
“Me and Nelly, we’re good friends,” Ashanti told People in another interview. “We kick it — hang out a lot. The industry is very hard, so it’s good to have fun and lighten it up.”
But when the interviewer asked if she was engaged to her pal, the “Foolish” singer said that they weren’t. Not yet.
“But definitely in the future,” Ashanti answered with a laugh.
2009: The “Body On Me” music video
Ashanti joined Nelly for a track on his fifth studio album, “Brass Knuckles.” In December of 2009, they released a music video for the steamy single, “Body On Me.”
Their seductive body language and eye contact while singing to one another in the clip seemed to say all the things about their partnership they’d long avoided saying themselves.
2013: The breakup
Rumors about a breakup were swirling around the pair shortly after the release of that music video. However, in 2010, they were spotted out together again, at T.I. and Tiny's wedding.

When asked about their on-and-off status after that, Nelly told Complex, “We never admitted that we were together or back together or separated, but we heard that. Only thing we ever said was we friends, and it’s the same way now.”
But by 2013, it was over for the pair, and like the rest of their relationship, they kept the particulars under wraps.
2021: A surprise reunion at Verzuz
During their years apart, Nelly and Ashanti didn’t have any contact at all, she told Andy Cohen on an episode of "Watch What Happens Live."
In fact, in a 2025 chat with Access Hollywood, Ashanti said they “kind of hated each other” after the break.

She went on to tell Angie Martinez, of the “IRL” podcast, “If someone had said, ‘Bet everything that you and Nelly will be back together,'” she would have responded, “Take it all. That ain’t never going to happen.”
But something happened to soften the rift in the fall of 2021. They had an unexpected reunion at Verzuz, when Ja Rule and Fat Joe brought them (and many others) on stage.

“I had somebody with me when I went to Verzuz,” Nelly later explained in an interview for “The Bootleg Kev Podcast.” “I didn’t want it tense. We didn’t even talk. I just went over, got a hug, break the ice and boom. And we didn’t talk for probably another eight to nine months to a year. We didn’t have a conversation. That was that.”
But he added, “Everything happens for a reason.”
2022: They’re back together and 'in a better place'

In December 2022, after the fan response to seeing Nelly and Ashanti together at Verzuz and then watching them share the stage a year later for a performance of “Body On Me” for Power 98.3, “Watch What Happens Live” host Andy Cohen told Ashanti, “People online want you and Nelly to get back together, that’s all I’m saying.”

She acknowledged the public excitement, and admitted, “What I will say is we’re in a better place. You know, 'cause before, it was (bad). But we’re cool now. Yeah, we have some conversations, you know. So it’s cool.”
In September 2023, Nelly chimed in on the topic when he visited “Boss Moves With Rasheeda,” and agreed, “Yeah, we cool again.”
He added, “I think it surprised both of us though. It wasn’t anything that I don’t think was planned.”
Nelly explained how the romance felt different this time around — like how there was "no pressure."

“Sometimes being separate you understand one another more,” Nelly said. “You could be like, ‘Yo, let me see exactly what they see.’ You know, because we all can be defensive sometimes in our own relationships. And we know we wrong but we going to stand on it. But we all a victim to that.”
2023: Proposal and "I dos"
Once they were back together, things moved fast for the couple, and in 2023, Nelly proposed.

While Ashanti sensed it might happen soon, given that they knew something the rest of the world didn't know yet — that a baby was on the way for the pair — her "jaw hit the floor" when he asked, all the same.
"I had on his t-shirt and boxers; I was in the bed," Ashanti told Tamron Hall. "It was so not cute; hair in a bun. You know what I mean? But it was us. We were home."
And she was, briefly, too stunned to respond.
“He was like, ‘Well, are you going to answer?’" she recalled. "He literally said, ‘Well, yes or no?’ But it was magical, it was beautiful. ... Everything happens in God’s divine timing.”
By December of that year, they were married.
2024: It's a boy!
On July 18, the newlyweds welcomed Kareem Kenkaide Haynes, otherwise known as KK, to their family.

“He’s my best friend," Ashanti of the little one during a 2025 stop by Jenna & Friends. "He’s like the sweetest little angel baby. He just laughs and smiles all day. I couldn’t even imagine my life without him now. I’m so happy.”
But what she can imagine, is expanding their family even further. Eventually.
“I definitely want more kids, but maybe not right this second,” she laughed.

title: A ‘Sandlot’ Star Played with the Savannah Bananas and Was a Real ‘Ham’
summary: "The Sandlot" star Patrick Renna reflected on what the movie meant to him and fans after he got to play with the Savannah Bananas.
story: The Savannah Bananas served up a little Ham in a recent game.
Patrick Renna, who starred as Ham in 1993’s “The Sandlot,” suited up for the baseball team during its game May 31 in Anaheim, California.

Renna relished the opportunity, while also taking a moment to reflect on the enduring popularity of “The Sandlot” in an Instagram post featuring a series of photos of him in uniform, with one of him calling his shot, just like his character did in the movie.

“People ask if it ever gets old talking about the same movie for over 30 years. It doesn’t. How could it?” he wrote. “I’ve gotten to meet so many amazing people because of it. It’s been passed down through three generations at this point. That’s pretty crazy. Why else would you want to be an actor, director, or filmmaker if not to be part of something that means as much as The Sandlot does to so many people?”
Renna, who came out to thunderous applause from the fans, said getting to play with the Bananas was an amazing experience.

“This night with the Savannah Bananas reminded me how special being part of this movie is. A night to remember. Even more special was that my 8-year-old was there to see 45,000 people cheer on his pop,” he wrote. “Thank you everyone for doing that.”
Renna ended up popping out, but that didn’t detract from the moment. He also told the pitcher, “Come on, DeNunez, you call that the heater?” in a reference to a line in “The Sandlot.”

“I’m sorry I didn’t hit it out of the park,” he wrote. “400 feet is a lot longer than the sandlot was. But, hey, I got a piece! Was it a meatball? Yes. But it was still a 70 MPH meatball. Fine, 63. Whatever who’s counting? Not the point! Is yellow slimming? No, no it’s not. Also not the point!
“The point is, I just wanted to say that moment meant a whole lot to me, and I just wanted to say thank you to all the people who still love this movie us 9 boys made over 3 decades ago.”
Renna wrapped up his post by hoping he can one day find something else that will resonate with fans the way “The Sandlot” has.
“Hopefully I can continue to entertain you with more projects that mean even a fraction of what ‘The Sandlot’ has meant,” he wrote.
Renna has marveled at how “The Sandlot” has stood the test of time.
“I don’t think any of us imagined that the movie would turn into what it has,” he told TODAY.com in 2019.
“We knew that it was good, but I don’t think that there’s any way to know that it would mean this much to so many people as it does now,” he continued.

title: Mariska Hargitay Is on a Quest to Reclaim Her Family Story in Vulnerable 'My Mom Jayne' Trailer
summary: Mariska Hargitay debuted the trailer for "My Mom Jayne," the HBO documentary she directed about her mom, Jayne Mansfield, on the TODAY show.
story: Mariska Hargitay has helped people share their stories for years on TV and through her foundation, and now, she wants to share hers.
The trailer for “My Mom Jayne,” the “Law & Order: SVU” star’s documentary about her late mother, Jayne Mansfield, aired exclusively June 3 on TODAY.
The HBO film, which premiered in May at the Cannes Film Festival, is also the first project under Hargitay’s newly launched production company, Mighty Entertainment.
Hargitay narrates the trailer, which opens with black-and-white footage of Mansfield before jumping to video of Hargitay opening boxes and sorting through memorabilia about her mom.
“I’ve spent my whole life distancing myself from my mother, Jayne Mansfield, the sex symbol,” she says, as racy images of Mansfield pop up on screen.
Old news clips and photos document the Hollywood bombshell’s rise to fame.
“I use my pinup-type publicity to get my foot in the door,” Mansfield says in one of the videos.

As an image of Olivia Benson — Hargitay’s famous “SVU” character — appears, the Emmy winner explains that her mother’s path to stardom made her want to carve a much different career for herself in the entertainment industry.
“But I want to understand her now,” Hargitay says.

She then reflects on losing her parents, saying she has no memories of her mom, who died in a car accident in 1967 when Hargitay was 3 years old. Hargitay and two of her brothers, Zoltan and Mickey Jr., were in the car at the time of the accident. Their father, Hungarian bodybuilder Mickey Hargitay, raised them and died in 2006.
Hargitay says she’s never talked to her siblings, including the oldest — Jayne Marie, whom Mansfield had with her high school boyfriend turned husband at 17 — about their experiences with their mom.
The trailer shows Hargitay, who also serves as director of the film, respectively settling her brothers and sister in for interviews.
“Anything you ask, you know I’m there for you,” Mickey Jr. says.
“You have all these memories, and I’m envious of that,” Hargitay expresses in another scene to Jayne Marie, who was 16 when Mansfield died.
“In the beginning, I had her to myself,” Jayne Marie says over archival video footage of her with her mom. “She’d take me everywhere.”
Mansfield, who spoke to the press often and especially loved her fans, took her kids almost everywhere she went on the road.
“When you’re a kid, you don’t know anything else,” Mickey Jr. says. “This is life.”
Zoltan says in the trailer that their mother’s playful on-camera persona, which included a put-on, breathy voice, was “actually a character.”
“The public pays to see me a certain way,” Mansfield says in an old clip.
“I looked the other way because I knew she was really smart,” Mickey Jr. says of his mom, who was fluent in multiple languages and played violin and piano.
“At home, she was just Jayne,” Jayne Marie says.
“I’ve heard things that are really ugly,” Hargitay says.
“I don’t know that I want to know those ugly things,” says Tony Cimber, Hargitay’s half brother, whom Mansfield had with ex-husband and director Matt Cimber.

Hargitay revealed publicly for the first time in a May 2025 interview with Vanity Fair that her biological father isn’t Mickey Hargitay, but Italian singer Nelson Sardelli. The topic also appears to be touched upon near the end of the trailer.
“I pulled out this picture, couldn’t believe what I was seeing. It was like the floor fell out from underneath me,” Hargitay says.
“Why didn’t he tell me?” Hargitay asks brother Zoltan.
She told Vanity Fair she once confronted their father about Sardelli but said he denied the claim, and she never mentioned Sardelli to him again.
That’s just one layer to the documentary’s narrative, which has a singular, larger focus for Hargitay.
“Reclaiming our family story — that is what this is about for me,” Hargitay says over clips of her siblings coming together in a garage full of their mother’s memories, “because she’s a part of me.”
“I want to know her as Jayne — my mom, Jayne,” she says, as the video fades to black showing footage of Mansfield smiling and playing the piano.
“My Mom Jayne” will have its North American premiere June 13 at the Tribeca Festival. It will air June 27 on HBO at 8 p.m. ET and stream on Max.

title: 'Bachelorette' Star Katie Thurston Says She's Losing Her Memory and Hair Amid Cancer Battle
summary: Katie Thurston, star of “The Bachelorette,” says she is losing her hair and her memory as she continues treatment for breast cancer.
story: Katie Thurston, star of “The Bachelorette” Season 17, is giving the “uncut, raw” reality of going through Stage 4 breast cancer treatment at age 34.
In a June 1 video updating her followers on her journey, Thurston said she just finished her second month of treatment. She also noted that her cancer treatment lasts “technically forever.”
“After finishing two months of my medication, my hair is coming out in an unnatural amount of clumps — working on that,” she said, pointing to the camera. “I’m losing my memory. That’s great.”

Thurston recalled a recent event going through customs, likely referring to her return from a trip to Italy with husband Jeff Arcuri. She explained she was was asked where she was coming from and she couldn't remember.

“But yeah cancer is s-----,” Thurston continued. “Sometimes, I’m like, ‘Stop feeling bad for yourself.’ Then other times, I’m like, ‘No, you’re allowed to feel bad for yourself. Cancer f------ sucks.’”
In March, Thurston revealed in an Instagram video that her cancer spread to her liver. Now, she explained that she has to make “big decisions on how to treat my liver.”
She had been considering radiation, ablation and histotripsy, which she said she ultimately chose to undergo with NYU Langone Health.
Histotripsy is a radiology procedure that uses ultrasound waves to treat liver tumors, according to Johns Hopkins Medicine.
“Anyways, it’s National Cancer Survivor’s Day and, you know, every day that I’m alive, I’m a survivor,” she said in her June video with a laugh.
Thurston added that she’s trying different medications to suppress her hormones and help with the treatment of her cancer, and if they don’t work, she many need her ovaries removed.
“But the vacation was nice. Now, I’m back at it again in New York City, trying to live my best life as a f------ cancer patient,” she concluded.

“The Bachelorette” alum revealed her breast cancer diagnosis in an emotional Instagram post Feb. 15. Having “no family history” of breast cancer, she subsequently shared on March 18 in another Instagram video that she discovered a “painful” small lump, which she described as a “rubbery, marble” in her breast. Initially, she ignored the lump for "several months," thinking it was a result of premenstrual syndrome or exercise, but she eventually went her to the doctor.
“A reminder that you can’t be ‘too young’ for breast cancer,” she captioned the March video.

On March 28, Thurston shared in another video update that she was informed the breast cancer had spread to her liver, which placed her at Stage 4. She added that she was also classified as triple positive.

A cancer identified as triple positive involves cancerous cells that grow using three different types of receptors, according to the the MD Anderson Cancer Center. This is a subtype of HER2 positive breast cancer, which is considered to be the most treatable type of breast cancer.

“I know Stage 4 can sound very scary, and it can be. However, given that I am triple positive, and the spots on my liver are fairly small and detected early, I feel very optimistic on my outcome,” she said in the video, adding that she planned to start chemotherapy treatment.
Thurston has also been open about her fertility journey amid cancer treatment, noting that she's freezing her eggs so she and Arcuri can try to have a child.

“Now that I have #stage4breastcancer , pregnancy would be a risk for me, especially as someone with HR+ breast cancer (feeds off hormones),” she captioned a May 24 Instagram video on their IVF journey. “So in the future, we will peruse #surrogacy in hopes of starting our family.”

title: Helen Mirren Shocks Table of Female Actors by Saying ‘None of Us Are Beautiful’
summary: Helen Mirren told a group of female actors during a roundtable conversation for The Hollywood Reporter that no one at the table was beautiful.
story: Helen Mirren stunned her fellow leading ladies by announcing that none one of them was beautiful when they gathered recently to discuss the craft of acting.

“None of us are beauties," Mirren, 79, told the group — which also included Kathy Bates, Parker Posey, Niecy Nash-Betts, Keri Russell and Cristin Milioti  —  during The Hollywood Reporter’s annual roundtable of dramatic female actors.
The conversation about appearances started when the panel discussed some of the bad advice they received during their careers. "I was told to have a nose job in my 20s," Mirren recalled.
“Someone said, ‘You’ll never get work if you don’t have a nose job.’ I said no. I didn’t want to be a pretty actress anyway. I elected to be not so pretty,” she added.
Mirren's recollection surprised the others, including Nash-Betts, 55, who said while she likes looking her best in real life, she's all for looking "like a dog" onscreen if a role demands it.
"I feel sorry for people who have been beautiful their whole life," said Nash-Betts. "Because when that’s what you’re known for, you got to keep it up for your whole life? I don’t know what I’d do."
At that point, Bates, 76, chimed in to say that no matter what an actor really looks like, they are "beautiful" when they deliver "an amazing performance."
"They're hot!" agreed Milioti, 39.
That's when Mirren weighed in on the group's attractiveness. "Looking at our faces around this table, none of us are beautiful," she told the others.
Bates, who's made headlines for both her starring role in CBS's "Matlock" reboot and her 100-pound weight loss, shot back, "Oh, get out of town! I feel more beautiful than I have in my entire life."
But Mirren insisted. "We’re not. None of us are beauties. We all have really different faces, very interesting faces," she said.
Russell, 49, asked Mirren if she meant none of them were "model beautiful."
"We all know what 'beautiful' is like," Mirren replied.
Russell then made everyone the table laugh by quipping, "Kathy’s like, 'Speak for yourself.'"

title: JoJo Siwa confirms she and Chris Hughes are dating after meeting on 'Celebrity Big Brother UK'
summary: JoJo Siwa has confirmed her relationship with Chris Hughes has turned romantic.
story: JoJo Siwa has confirmed her relationship with Chris Hughes has turned romantic.
The two sparked dating rumors during their time on “Celebrity Big Brother UK." At the time, Siwa was in a relationship, which ended shortly after the cast left the Big Brother mansion.
Siwa, 22, told The Guardian her connection with Hughes, a 32-year-old former "Love Island" star, is “not platonic any more.”

“It’s not platonic any more, and it’s been a beautiful development, a beautiful connection, and I’m absolutely head over heels for him and he’s the same way,” Siwa said in an interview published Monday, June 2.
When asked if she has a message for anyone thinking the relationship is a “PR stunt,” Siwa told the publication, “Clearly, you’ve never been around us."

“I won’t ever speak for him, but for me personally, the happiness in my life just radiates off of me right now,” she continued. “Literally yesterday, I was massaging my cheeks; I’ve never (before) been in pain from smiling so much.”

The two became close friends on the reality competition show while she was still in a relationship with ex Kath Ebbs. After the series wrapped, Ebbs revealed in a since-deleted TikTok that Siwa ended their relationship at the show's April afterparty. Siwa then confirmed they were no longer together.
In the “Celebrity Big Brother” house, fans quickly noticed Siwa and Hughes’ natural chemistry, which she told The Guardian was “a very genuine connection — we’re not faking a thing.”
After leaving the house in late April, Siwa and Hughes remained inseparable, sharing pictures and videos together on social media, including playing game night with the singer's family.
But it's taken some time for the two to say whether their relationship was romantic.
In their first joint interview after the show's finale, Hughes described their connection at the time as a “soulmate friendship." Siwa agreed at the time, calling their relationship “platonic.”

In a carousel of photos posted to Instagram last month for her birthday, Siwa opened with a shot of her nuzzled into Hughes' neck with his hand on her thigh. He shared a similarly cozy black-and-white image last month, among other pictures together, writing, “The previous 7 days have been the prettiest...”
While confirming the romance, Siwa told The Guardian she understands why dating rumors have created such a buzz.
“People can see our chemistry, and they got to see it develop,” she said, later adding, “I think everyone’s just curious, and I can’t blame them.”
After previously coming out as a member of the LGBTQ+ community in 2021, Siwa said on “Celebrity Big Brother” that she prefers to describe herself as “queer” rather than “lesbian.”
On June 1, Siwa celebrated the start of Pride Month with a loving message on her Instagram story.
“Happy day 1 of the happiest month,” she began, adding a rainbow hue of hearts to represent the colors of the Pride flag.

“What I have learned over the last 22 years is that pride is all about love, acceptance, and celebration. No matter who you are or what you are, you are you, you are beautiful, and you are perfect,” she wrote at the time. “Everyone’s story is different and everyone’s journey is different.”
“The most beautiful thing about love is that it’s just love,” she continued. “Happy pride to the beautiful lgbtqia+ community, to the alias, and to all that exist :).”

title: Bethenny Frankel Discusses Her Look at Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Runway Show: 'My Body Is Natural'
summary: Bethenny Frankel addressed social media chatter about her appearance after the 2025 Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Runway Show.
story: Bethenny Frankel addressed social media chatter about her appearance after the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Runway Show.
The former “Real Housewives of New York City” star posted a video on Instagram on June 2 sharing more details about what it was like to walk in the runway show.
"I guess we have to discuss what I looked like on that runway, because the internet is so fascinated with my age, my weight, my face, my hair," she said.

Frankel, 54, wore several bathing suits during the runway event in Miami, including a one-piece swimsuit with cheetah print and pink bikini with black polka dots, plus a black mesh cover-up that she took off at one point.

"Listen, I can tell you with great certainty that every woman that was with me on that stage did not look that way two hours prior," Frankel said. "OK, it was everybody's job, and that's what goes on in Hollywood, in the entertainment industry, and the images that you and your daughters see of women, of Kim Kardashian, of Beyoncé, of J.Lo, of every famous person, that there is a lot of work that goes into that, a lot of glam, a lot of contouring, a lot of lighting, a lot."
Frankel added that she does not normally wear makeup, and that she doesn't crash diet.

"I don't go to a gym. I don't have a workout. I walk on the beach. Everything I do has balance. I self-regulate so I have a good relationship with food and exercise," she said. "It wasn't always that way. This is not that I have a good metabolism or just good genes, because I used to be 25 pounds heavier in my early 30s."
Frankel said she doesn't have issues with "food noise" or "exercise noise" at this point in her life.

"The reason my body is natural is because the exercise that I do, and have always done for my body is natural. I'll go months without exercise, and definitely days without doing anything, but I always come back to it," she said. "I have a good relationship with it, and I have a good relationship with food because it's the obsession, it's the extremes, it's the binging, it's the emotions, it's the noise. That is why we are struggling."
She concluded by telling her followers, "I want you to allow yourselves to have, but not beat yourselves up when you do indulge. And I want you to have a good relationship with food and exercise."
Frankel spoke more about her experience participating in the show in a June 1 Instagram post.

"There are so many things I could say about the Sports Illustrated experience. I didn't know much going into it. I mean, I know it's a magazine, and I know that once a year they do a swimsuit issue," she said.
"What I didn't know is what the culture is like there. And I didn't know who 90% of the women were. I will tell you that the resounding theme and culture is women supporting women," she continued.
Frankel said the women at the event were not just giving compliments, but asking about what people were planning to do during their walks and helping them with their ideas.

"I have to say that as much as the runway show was really fun ... I wasn't nervous. I was aware of my age. I was aware that I'm not a model, and there were a lot of models, and I was just like, 'Am I gonna stick this landing or make an absolute fool myself and embarrass you guys?'" she said.

In the caption of another Instagram post, she summarized the event: "This runway show was such an amazing experience and I am forever grateful to my community here in Florida and the people for your endless support."

title: Miley Cyrus Gets Candid About Her Stance on Having Kids
summary: Miley Cyrus shared her reasoning on if she was interested in becoming a parent, and fans loved her answer.
story: Miley Cyrus shared her reasoning on if she was interested in becoming a parent, and fans loved her answer.
Cyrus, 32, said she wasn't focused on having kids right now on the May 31 episode of "The Interview" podcast from The New York Times.

"It's not something I'm focused on," Cyrus said. "For being such an opinionated, sure person, this is a element in my life that I've always been pretty not super attached to, like a yes or no answer."
The "Flowers" singer referenced a conversation she had with her stepfather, Dominic Purcell, who married her mother, Tish Cyrus, in 2023.

"I was talking to my step dad, and he said, 'Why are you the only celebrity without a makeup line?' And I said, 'Because I'm not passionate about it.' He said, 'That's the right answer,'" she recalled.
Cyrus added that she feels the same way about motherhood.

"It's just never been something that I've been overly, you know, passionate about, and it's a lot of responsibility and it's a lot of devotion and energy," she said.
